Text: Rose opens her eyes to find herself lying on a sofa.

Where did I go wrong? Or maybe, everything was wrong
from the very beginning.
They...!
My father...!

When Rose saw her mother embracing Perv, she felt
as if her entire life had been a lie.
Agh... Aahh...

I want to go home...! Let me go...! I want to go
back to how things used to be...!
Cid...!

Just as she thinks this, she hears the beautiful
sound of a piano melody.
"Moonlight Sonata"...

She follows the sound of the piano as if being led
by it.

She will never forget it. The music that Shadow
played in the underground sanctuary that night.

However, the person sitting beyond her open window
is a plain boy with black hair.

Wondering if she is dreaming again, Rose staggers
toward the piano.
Cid....Cid...

Let's escape together. Go somewhere far away where
no one knows who we are...

I killed my father, I was betrayed by my mother...
I betrayed the Shadow Garden and was forsaken
by my people.

Only you, Cid...have been with me to the very end.
Despite everything...
So, as long as I have you—
I like this song.
It makes the world...make sense.
The world...

I divide the world into two categories. Things that
matter to me and those that don't.
Why...why is that?

Because I have a dream that I can't achieve
if I don't.
Your dream...

There are only so many hours in a day, only so much
effort a person can give.

That's why I pour all of mine into what's important,
and I cast everything else aside.
What is important... Just for me...!
But, there's too much static.

The world is full of it, and it obscures those
important things. It's easy for us to lose sight
of what matters.

The way I see it, the world is a little too bright.
It shows you too many things, and it makes you lose
sight of what's truly precious.
What is...
So, this world is best seen under the moonlight.

It forces us to strain our eyes so that we keep our
sights fixed on what's important.

Under the moonlight, all we have to look at is
what's precious to us. So tell me—
What is it you see, in this moonlit world?
*gasp*!

With those final words, he vanishes. There is nobody
at the piano bench, as if he was nothing more than
an illusion cast by the moon's light.
...Cid?

But he was no illusion. A small ring sits on the
bench where he just was. It shines in the moonlight.
A wedding ring.

It has artistic patterns and a faint magical power.
It is impossible to say how expensive it was.
Clearly, he had carefully chosen it.
Cid...
Huh? It should be here...it's gone.
I lost the ring.

Someone must have nabbed it off me... Grr, I'll get
them back for this.
(Well, I wasn't carrying any cash on me anyway.)

(I think I persuaded Rose, so if she's got the heart
of a lion, I'm sure she'll get back on her feet and
raise the flag of rebellion. Maybe...hopefully...)
Oh, Epsilon.
Need your back washed, Master Shadow?

(Her slime body has developed to the point that
they look like the real thing.)
Hehe...you're a little embarrassed, I see.

I have no need for embarrassment...they have great
texture and shape. Good work on making it this far.
Hehehe, naturally.
Something unexpected happened today.
Well...anything important?
Nothing that should be a problem, I think.

She has the key. If she still has the strength to
stand up, then that should naturally light the
fires of rebellion in her.

You gave the key...to her?! Even after we searched
everywhere for it...

It will all come to a head in 3 days...at the
wedding.
The lioness will awaken!

(...Or at least in three days she can sort out her
feelings.)

It is the day of the wedding. Perv is wearing a
wedding suit, eagerly awaiting the ceremony.
Just a little more...
Just a bit more, and it will all come together.

Though, thinking about it there were more than
a few hiccups...

Everything was going fine until they used that
idiot woman to make the king into a puppet... Geerk,
that moron tampered with the ring with no care for
safety...!

Ownership of the Ring of Succession was passed from
the king to Princess Rose.

Mordred said I must marry Rose to gain ownership
over the ring, and that my blood has to join with
the royal line.

All of this for an artifact...what a truly obnoxious
and roundabout way of doing things!
Well, no matter, the results have been excellent.
My seat in the Rounds...!
My seat...
I will be in the Rounds!
I will be in the Rounds!
The box is empty. There is no sign of the ring.
...Wait.
No...wait, no, no, no!
Wh-Where did it go? Where could it be...?!
It's not here...
It's gone.
It's...really gone?
Perv Asshat...
Eep!
Mordred...! My Lord...!
Good to see you, Perv Asshat.

The preparations are complete. After the wedding,
the 12th seat in the Rounds will be yours.
Under...understood...!
Hehe...don't disappoint me.
Perv Asshat.
...Th-Th-Th-Th-The...!

The Ring of Succession is not needed straight
away!
I must find some excuse to delay handing it over.
What should I do?!
